Key Match Events: England's chase began disastrously with Jos Buttler's dismissal for a two-ball duck
Alex Hales was caught for seven with a miscued pull
Ben Stokes was bowled for six by Fionn Hand
Dawid Malan was dropped on 23 by Gareth Delany
Harry Brook was caught for 18 off George Dockrell
Moeen hammered a six and three fours to give England a fighting chance
Pre-Game Insights: England's task only gets harder as they face champions Australia at the MCG on Friday, a virtual knockout for both
Captain Jos Buttler said Ireland were excellent and outplayed them
Post-Match Reflections: Captain Jos Buttler said Ireland were excellent and outplayed them
Ireland captain Andy Balbirnie was named Man of the Match, having led from the front with a top score of 62 off 47 balls
Miscellaneous Highlights: Rain forced an early finish at the Melbourne Cricket Ground
Ireland's win threw the Super 12s wide open and triggered rain-dancing among green-clad pockets of fans
Others: England's hopes of reaching the T20 World Cup semi-finals suffered a major dampener
Ireland, who have already upset West Indies at the tournament, produced a disciplined bowling performance to restrict England's big hitters
